cheatsheet.title: IT Baseline Protection with Greenbone and verince

intro.description:
In connection with a Greenbone vulnerability scanner (www.greenbone.net) as well as a OpenVAS vulnerability scanner (www.openvas.org) verinice enables an effective vulnerability management.
Importing the results of a vulnerability scan into verinice in the BSI Baseline Security provides the functionalities structural analysis, modeling and automatic basisc security check.

item.title: Performing IT Baseline Protection Scans in Greenbone
item.description:
The Greenbone Security Manager allows automatic checks according to the IT-baseline catalogues by the German authority "Bundesamt f√ºr Sicherheit in der Informationstechnik (BSI)".
For a detailled description how to perform an IT-baseline scan in Greenbone please refer to the user manual or visit the Greenbone Learning Center (www.greenbone.net/learningcenter/task_it_grundschutz.de).
You will find a special scan configuration and an IT baseline protection report plugin to use in verinice for download.

item.title: Exporting the Scan Results
item.description:
Select Scan Management > Reports from the Greenbone Security Assistant menu to export the results of a successful scan.
Export the results of an IT-baseline scan as vna-file by choosing the format verinice ITG in the corresponding drop-down-box and start the export by pressing the button Download Filtered Report. Greenbone will save the vna-file in the download directory in your system environment.

item.title: Importing the IT Baseline Protection Scan
item.description:
Switch to the IT-baseline perspective in verinice using menu View > Show perspective > BSI IT Baseline Perspective. Start the import by clicking the button Import organisation from file.... Select the previously exported Greenbone ITG-Report by clicking the button Select file..., keep the default values for all other parameters in the dialogue.
The imported objects can be found in the group Imported objects > GSM ITGS Import > IT-Systems: Server. All scan targets have been imported as server with a description in the field Tags. Each of the imported objects has a child object GSM Result with the resulting controls of the scan.

item.title: Structural Analysis
item.description:
Transfer the imported objects in your organisation by navigating to imported objects > GSM ITGS import > IT-systems: Server. Select the server objects and choose Cut from the context menu.
Nvaigate now to your organisation i.e. IT Network > IT-Systems: Server and insert the systems there by right mouseclick Insert.

item.title: Greenbone: Automatically Add a Module
item.description:
Open the view BSI Baseline Protection Catalog in the menu View > Show View > BSI Baseline Protection Catalog. Attention - without active BSI Baseline Protection Catalog the automatic adding of modules will not be performed!
Navigate to one of the mooved objects (server) in your organisation an right-klick Greenbone: Automatically add module.... Refresh the view by clicking the Button Refresh view (Strg+F5).
The BSI baseline modules will be assigned to the corresponding objects based on the tags.

item.title: Greenbone: Automatic Basic Security Check
item.description:
With right mouseclick on one of the objects choose the option Greenbone: Automatic basic security check. verinice transfers all controls as well as the implementation status from the imported GSM-scan onto the previously added modules.
The automatic basic security check transfers only those controls from BSI module layers 4 an 5, due to the reason that non technical controls can not be scanned by the vulnerability scanner.
